en: Sing aloud unto God our strength: Make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.
hmr: Pathien a mi sukhrâttu chawimawiin hlimtakin hla sak unla, Jakob Pathien chawimawiin hlimtakin khêk ro.

en: Raise a song, and bring hither the timbrel, The pleasant harp with the psaltery.
hmr: Inpâkna hla sak unla, khuongtê dâm, Ṭingṭang ngainuomumtak dâm, perkhuong dâm leh hung chawi ro,

en: Blow the trumpet at the new moon, At the full moon, on our feast-day.
hmr: Thla thara chun tawtawrâwt mût unla, Thla lir laia ei ruoiṭhe hun lai leh.

en: For it is a statute for Israel, An ordinance of the God of Jacob.
hmr: Israelhai ta dinga thuruot a ni sih a, Jakob Pathien dân a nih.

en: He appointed it in Joseph for a testimony, When he went out over the land of Egypt, Where I heard a language that I knew not.
hmr: Chu chu Josef-a chun thu inhriettirna dingin a ruot a, Aigupta rama a fe thleng lai khan; Ka ṭawng hriet naw râwl ka hriet a

en: I removed his shoulder from the burden: His hands were freed from the basket.
hmr: An liengko chu thil rika inthawkin ka lâk hmang a, An kuthai chu leikhâwra inthawka inthlain a um kha.

en: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder; I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. [Selah
hmr: Lunginzîngin in mi ko a, ka sanhim cheu a, Vâninrûm inbîkhmangna hmuna khan ka dawn cheu a; Meriba tuia khan kân fie cheu kha.

en: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wouldest hearken unto me!
hmr: Aw ka mihai, ngai unla, inhriettir ka ti cheu, Aw Israelhai, ka thu ngai ta ve unla chu aw!

en: There shall no strange god be in thee; Neither shalt thou worship any foreign god.
hmr: Ram dang pathien hrim hrim in lai an um ding a ni nawh a, Mi dang pathien hrim hrim chu in biek ding a ni bawk nawh.

en: I am Jehovah thy God, Who brought thee up out of the land of Egypt: Open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
hmr: Kei LALPA in Pathien chu ka nih; Aigupta rama inthawka ṭhuoi suoktu cheu kha. In bau ka lien unla, ka suksip ding annâwm.

en: But my people hearkened not to my voice; And Israel would none of me.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ka mihai chun ka râwl an ngai si nawh a; Israelhai chun an mi dit naw kha.

en: So I let them go after the stubbornness of their heart, That they might walk in their own counsels.
hmr: Chuongchun, an lungril kâwmaw ang peia um dingin ka thlathlam a, Anni remruot anga an umna dingin.

en: Oh that my people would hearken unto me, That Israel would walk in my ways!
hmr: Aw, ka mihai hin ka thu ngaiin, Israelhai hi ka lampuia hin fe hai sien chu aw!

en: I would soon subdue their enemies, And turn my hand against their adversaries.
hmr: An hmêlmahai chu ka suktlâwm vakin, Anni dotuhai chunga chun ka kut kân let ding bah.

en: The haters of Jehovah should submit themselves unto him: But their time should endure for ever.
hmr: LALPA theidatuhai chu a hmaah ṭiin kûn an tih, An hrem tuorna chun kumkhuo dai a tih.

en: He would feed them also with the finest of the wheat; And with honey out of the rock would I satisfy thee.
hmr: Nangni chu bu ṭhatakin châwm ka ti cheu a, Lungpuia khuoizuin ka sukkhawp ding cheu a nih.
